posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
Hello Everybody. I am noah.
I am going to build the secure chatting app.
So I forked signal app server & android version.
But I can’t find the detailed guide to run server & android on local.
I am looking for the person who can teach me how to run & how to set the config file.
Thank you for your help.
Best Regards.

Hi,

I can’t really help with the server side of it, but what exactly do you mean by “running android on local”?
If you just want to compile you own android apk, you can check out the wiki:

GitHub

Configuring Android Studio

A private messenger for Android. Contribute to signalapp/Signal-Android development by creating an account on GitHub.

Kindly
desert nip

link_counts.title: Configuring Android Studio · signalapp/Signal-Android Wiki · GitHub

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
Thank you for your response.
I am going to set up server on local and android too.
For this, How to set the config file of server?
And How to set build.gradle.kt file of android?
Thanks again.

Unfortunately, as I wrote before, I can’t help with the server. Generally, the official repository already contains a build.gradle.kts file, which should work fine for the use of android studio.
I’m still not quite sure though what you mean by setting up android on local. Are you planning to modify our just to compile it yourself?

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
I am going to use my own server.
So I have to update build.gradle.kts file.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked: I lunched the server

posts.name: Rui Ding
posts.cooked: Hi, can you tell me the version of Signal you have successfully lunched and the features you have implemented?

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
Hi.
I luched latest version a few days ago.

posts.name: Mordordaily
posts.cooked: how do you launch it on your own server?

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
I’ve launched server on AWS.
For this, you need 4 cloud services(AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure, Cloudflare).
And need to run several servers for all functionality.
it will takes much time.

posts.name: cc
posts.cooked: I have deployed dozens of Signal-Server components on my own infrastructure, operating completely independently without relying on any third-party services like Amazon, Cloudflare, GCP, or Azure.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked: That’s amazing. Did u deploy the svr2 server too?

posts.name: cc
posts.cooked: I changed the client code, using a simple http api instead it. including svr2 and cdsi.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked: Could you know me the server version what u deployed?

posts.name: cc
posts.cooked:
I cloned the latest version directly from GitHub in early last month - specifically the early April 2025 release with git tag v20250409.1.0.

only little change.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
That Sounds great.
Do u know what’s for tus server and storage manager server?

posts.name: cc
posts.cooked: certainly, for the storage service, I modified the code to remove GCP/Bigtable dependencies. for tus, I reimplemented code in Golang, removed the Cloudflare dependency.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked:
I am sorry, I mean why I have to deploy these servers?
What are these for?

posts.name: cc
posts.cooked: tus for chat attachment storage.

posts.name: Noah Thomson
posts.cooked: Thanks but it works for chat attachment without tus server.
